snippet: At least 54 people were killed on Monday as militants stormed a Tunisian town near the border.
abstract: Tunisian security forces repel attack by unknown assailants in Ben Gardane, town near Libyan border; Pres Beji Caid Essebsi says Islamic State was behind attack that killed at least 54; northern border with Libya is sealed and curfew is imposed in effort to secure area.

byline.original: By FARAH SAMTI and DECLAN WALSH
byline.contributor: Farah Samti reported from Tunis, and Declan Walsh from Cairo.

lead_paragraph: At least 54 people were killed on Monday as militants stormed a Tunisian town near the border.

headline.main: Tunisian Clash Spreads Fear That Libyan War Is Spilling Over
headline.print_headline: Raid in Tunisia Kills Dozens and Spreads Fear That Libyan Chaos Is Spilling Over

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
